primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The cosmic movement of the Divine Word (Wisdom/Adonai/Root/Key) from the mouth of the Most High into the prison of human darkness to effect a 'speedy' deliverance and transfiguration of creation.

subject.identificatie: The Coming Christ (under various titles: Sapientia, Adonai, Radix, Clavis, Oriens, Rex, Emmanuel).
tekstueel_bewijs: O Wisdom... reaching from one end to the other mightily
O Key... you open and no one can shut
Come and save the human race whom you fashioned from clay

object.identificatie: The redemption and transfiguration of the human race and creation.
tekstueel_bewijs: deliver us from the prison house

zender.identificatie: The Most High / Heavenly Father (The source of the 'loving purposes').
tekstueel_bewijs: coming forth from the mouth of the Most High
the tale of the loving purposes of God

ontvanger.identificatie: The human race ('us'), specifically those in darkness and the shadow of death.
tekstueel_bewijs: enlighten those that dwell in darkness
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the prisoner/the clay) waiting for the Subject.

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit and the 'Armour of Light'.
tekstueel_bewijs: The Spirit of the Lord rests upon the branch
put upon us the armour of light
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; the Spirit is the internal/resting power of the Subject.
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling power upon the Messiah to act for the Receiver.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, Darkness, and the 'Prison House'.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad behavior but an ontological 'prison' and 'shadow of death' that requires a divine 'Key' to unlock.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response: preparing the heart and amending life in light of the coming Subject.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer ('we')
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The 'Bidding Prayer' establishes that we prepare *because* of the message of salvation wrought by Him. The primary program (God's coming) enables the secondary (our preparation).

voorbeelden_god_subject: You open and no one can shut
The Lord... leadest Joseph like a sheep

voorbeelden: to be put in mind of the great day of Judgment
prepare ourselves in heart and mind
teach us the way of prudence
with great might come among us
because we are sorely hindered... help and deliver us

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The liturgy focuses on the 'Inability' (Non-Pouvoir) of the human subject and the 'Sovereign Ability' (Pouvoir) of the Divine Subject. Grace is defined as the power that overcomes the 'hindrance' of sin.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'Prison' (~S1) through the 'Judgment' (S2) to the 'Redemption' (S1) via the 'Sacrifice' (~S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension between Judgment and Mercy is resolved by the 'perfect sacrifice' which allows the Judge to be the Savior.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Judgment is mentioned as a 'great day' and a 'glorious majesty' that necessitates grace.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The structure is profoundly theocentric. The human 'Subject' is consistently depicted as passive, hindered, or in prison, while the Divine 'Subject' is the only one capable of 'stirring up strength' and 'ordering all things.'

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: follow the pattern of his Son’s perfect life

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Active Subject of Salvation

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Christ's life is presented as a 'pattern' to follow, but only after the 'perfect sacrifice' has 'bought us.'
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The liturgy largely avoids this by focusing on Christ as the 'Root' and 'Key' (Ontological Savior) rather than just a teacher.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God initiates and completes the work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The movement from Wisdom (Creation) to Emmanuel (Incarnation) to Judgment (Eschaton) is perfectly integrated.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'preparing ourselves' (human act) and 'give us grace' (divine act).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: unlocks the prison of sin and death; lead the prisoners from the prison house

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit empowers the Messiah to fulfill the 'Pouvoir-faire' of redemption.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is a 'hindrance' and a 'prison' that humans cannot exit by their own 'Vouloir'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon/liturgy is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. God is the Subject of every transformative verb.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the 'Prisoner' identification for the hearer.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for Advent.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'Devoir' (amend our lives) remains a fruit of the 'Pouvoir' (grace).

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The opponent is already cosmic in scope.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This text demonstrates how liturgical structure can safeguard grace even when moral imperatives (amending life) are mentioned.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the beauty of the 'O' metaphors; Greimas shows these metaphors all share a single functional role: the Divine Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would look at the history of Isaiah; Greimas looks at how those texts are 're-acted' in the present narrative of the congregation.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Wisdom' and 'Key' are not just titles but 'Actants' that perform the specific function of overcoming the 'Opponent' (Prison).

appendices.notities: The repetitive 'Come' (Veni) reinforces the hearer's role as the waiting Receiver.
